tooltip.lets-do-quest-items.hearthstead_: [Right-Click] to perform a Leap of Heroism.
An ancient banner, once carried by a prominent ruler.
item.lets-do-quest-items.ancient_coin.to: A currency, long forgotten, once used by an ancient, thriving, civilization.
item.lets-do-quest-items.ancient_rune.to: A relic of old magic, used by an ancient civilization, but later forgotten.
Writing on a stone tablet, from before the development of paper.
item.lets-do-quest-items.animal_pelts.to: The pelt of an animal. Maybe a huntsman could use this...
item.lets-do-quest-items.bat_wings.toolt: Wings torn off of the bodies of dead bats, found deep within the caves.
item.lets-do-quest-items.bent_fork.toolt: A fork found in between the rubble of a village house.
A cloth covered in blood, perhaps from a wounded soldier or civilian...
item.lets-do-quest-items.blunt_knife.too: This knife is blunt... no signs of ever having been sharpened, such shame.
item.lets-do-quest-items.bone_dice.toolt: A die made out of bone, someone truly wicked or occult might've used this.
item.lets-do-quest-items.broken_chains.t: Something was held by these... but it seems that whatever it was has escaped...
item.lets-do-quest-items.broken_oar.tool: Left near a beached boat, the boat too was severely damaged.
item.lets-do-quest-items.broken_shield.t: One of many broken items found on a battlefield...
item.lets-do-quest-items.bundle_of_arrow: Seems like this still remains as part of the unused arsenal.
item.lets-do-quest-items.burnt_book.tool: I wonder what was written here, too bad it's burnt...
item.lets-do-quest-items.calendar.toolti: A calendar! Some dates are circled... might be important.
This dagger was recently used in combat, it's chipped at the edge.
item.lets-do-quest-items.commendation_ma: A mark of commendation! Only handed out to the bravest of soldiers.
item.lets-do-quest-items.cracked_bell.to: Probably taken from the rubble of a broken down church from the war...
item.lets-do-quest-items.cracked_gemston: A cracked ruby! This must've been carried by invading soldiers.
item.lets-do-quest-items.cracked_hourgla: Someone must've attempted to stop time... too bad that's not how it works.
Idiots! They say that breaking a mirror grants you 7 years of bad luck...
This looks like part of a mosaic often found in holy areas.
item.lets-do-quest-items.crooked_spear.t: A spear crooked by years of battle and warfare...
item.lets-do-quest-items.crude_drawing.t: Poor child... I hope they are okay.
item.lets-do-quest-items.cursed_amulet.t: An amulet carried by evokers to empower there cursed magic.
item.lets-do-quest-items.cursed_ring.too: A ring cursed by a great evil.
item.lets-do-quest-items.cursed_tome.too: A tome written in a language long forgotten. One of the major magic sources used by evokers.
item.lets-do-quest-items.dark_gemstone.t: It seems like the evokers were able to imbue echo shards with dark magic...
item.lets-do-quest-items.dark_orb.toolti: An orb oozing with dark magic, I wonder what looks back at you from the darkness within.
A rotting skull... could belong to any fallen soldier or evoker
Probably worn by some accursed illager king...
item.lets-do-quest-items.demon_horn.tool: Torn straight out of the head of a demon. Gruesome...
item.lets-do-quest-items.demonic_leather: Demon hide goes for quite a hefty price. I wonder what I'll be able to get for this.
item.lets-do-quest-items.dented_helmet.t: Worn by a fallen soldier. Every dent tells a different story.
item.lets-do-quest-items.dried_herbs.too: Maybe these herbs are medicinal! I'd have to ask a herbalist.
item.lets-do-quest-items.dull_axe.toolti: Definitely illager weaponry. I admire their choice of weaponry, though.
item.lets-do-quest-items.dusty_goblet.to: I wonder where this is from...
item.lets-do-quest-items.dusty_tome.tool: Covered in dust the text is hardly readable... 'I ##st #es#i#ula# t##si#n!'
item.lets-do-quest-items.empty_coffer.to: Darn! Empty... I wonder if someone would still buy it...
item.lets-do-quest-items.empty_flask.too: Probably belongs to some alchemist, I'll ask around.
item.lets-do-quest-items.engraved_locket: Engraved with the initials M. & L. encircled by a heart... How lovely!
An idol long forgotten, once used to worship an ancient deity.
An egg originating from the same time period as the Sniffers.
item.lets-do-quest-items.fossilized_toot: Probably belongs to the same creature or time period as the egg.
item.lets-do-quest-items.frayed_rope.too: A rope probably used to bind the wrists of bandits, when they were caught.
item.lets-do-quest-items.golden_key.tool: Shiny and gold, must belong to royalty! Let's see if I can get part of the treasury.
item.lets-do-quest-items.golden_necklace: A fancy necklace, most likely belonging to a person of wealth.
item.lets-do-quest-items.healing_herb.to: Now this one certainly heals, it tastes extremely bitter, though.
item.lets-do-quest-items.iron_cuffs.tool: A guard probably lost them, maybe I'll return them. Or not...
item.lets-do-quest-items.iron_key.toolti: I guess this opens the cuffs I've found.
item.lets-do-quest-items.iron_spike.tool: I wonder where this is from... a fence maybe? Or a collar?
item.lets-do-quest-items.jeweled_chalice: This will fetch great amounts of coin on the black market!
item.lets-do-quest-items.jeweled_crown.t: If the guards catch me with this, I'll surely be captured under assumption of theft... Better return it quickly.
item.lets-do-quest-items.moldy_bread.too: I wouldn't eat this if I were you...
item.lets-do-quest-items.moldy_cheese.to: STOP EATING MOLDY FOOD, WHAT'S WRONG WITH YOU?!
item.lets-do-quest-items.moss.tooltip.mo: Moss I took from a jungle temple, as a reminder of my travels.
item.lets-do-quest-items.moss_covered_id: An idol, found deep within the jungle temples. Used to worship an ancient deity.
Taken from the sarcophagus of an ancient pharaoh... Sure hope this isn't cursed...
item.lets-do-quest-items.old_coins.toolt: These coins were used a few centuries ago, by the older kings.
item.lets-do-quest-items.old_steel_basin: I wonder what this was used for...
A scrap of petrified wood, probably from some very old village house.
item.lets-do-quest-items.quiver_of_arrow: A soldier must've dropped this when they ran for safety during the illager invasions...
item.lets-do-quest-items.redcap_mushroom: Don't eat this, I swear to god!
item.lets-do-quest-items.rotten_chest.to: Fished this up, almost broke my rod doing so...
item.lets-do-quest-items.rusted_key.tool: Probably useless, but it might still open some rusty lock.
item.lets-do-quest-items.rusty_hammer.to: I wish the carpenters here would care more for their tools... This truly is a shame.
item.lets-do-quest-items.rusty_screw.too: I wonder what kind of contraption this belonged to...
How'd this end up here? This is from a completely different area far from the reaches of this kingdom.
item.lets-do-quest-items.rusty_sword.too: A sword covered in dried blood and rust, taken from the battlefield.
item.lets-do-quest-items.scattered_bones: I wonder what creature these belong to...
item.lets-do-quest-items.scorched_scroll: Scorched... must've contained important information for someone to haphazardly burn this.
item.lets-do-quest-items.severed_claw.to: I hope that I will never have to encounter the creature this belongs to...
item.lets-do-quest-items.shadowy_cloak.t: Good for staying hidden or to obscure yourself when people are looking for you!
item.lets-do-quest-items.shattered_armor: More shattered or broken equipment once worn by the strong warriors that defended this kingdom.
item.lets-do-quest-items.shattered_gem.t: A shattered amethyst, probably dropped by a fleeing alchemist.
Quite a shame, this was quality pottery too!
item.lets-do-quest-items.shredded_scroll: A crier's scroll. Probably contained a big announcement by the king.
item.lets-do-quest-items.silk.tooltip.si: Ahhh, fine silk used to weave comfortable clothing, clothing only available to those of wealth.
item.lets-do-quest-items.skeleton_key.to: A key that can open every single lock in the city, oh the power I hold...
item.lets-do-quest-items.snake_fang.tool: Taken from the biggest of snakes, used to make very potent poisons.
item.lets-do-quest-items.sooty_candlesti: This candlestick wasn't burnt at the wick...
item.lets-do-quest-items.spider_web.tool: Why would I carry this around?!
item.lets-do-quest-items.splintered_staf: The magical power once held inside has long perished... I wish I knew magic...
item.lets-do-quest-items.stale_water.too: You really shouldn't keep all of these spoiled consumables. sometimes, you worry me.
item.lets-do-quest-items.supply_box.tool: A crate full of supplies, probably remaining from the war...
item.lets-do-quest-items.tattered_map.to: This map is torn, but I can still see where the treasure is marked! Too bad I can't read the rest of the map, though.
item.lets-do-quest-items.torn_banner.too: A banner carried by one of many soldiers during the war.
item.lets-do-quest-items.torn_scroll.too: A scroll with magical symbols... I seriously need to study magic some time.
item.lets-do-quest-items.unholy_symbol.t: Carried by worshippers and cultists that worship some of the dark deities.
item.lets-do-quest-items.unlit_candle.to: Should I light it...? Probably not...
item.lets-do-quest-items.unlit_torch.too: I'll keep this until I venture some dark dungeons or caves.
item.lets-do-quest-items.used_bandages.t: Probably shouldn't use these again... don't want to get infected wounds.
item.lets-do-quest-items.warped_bow.tool: Try firing an arrow with this!
item.lets-do-quest-items.worn_boots.tool: Worn from long hikes through muddy battlefields, probably belonged to one of the soldiers.
item.lets-do-quest-items.worn_locket.too: Carried by a civilian or soldier to remember them of their significant other...
